description:
The App Needs Proper Navigation from Screen to Screen

Implement a comprehensive navigation system for seamless screen-to-screen transitions.

Technical Implementation:
- Navigation Library: React Navigation (web/mobile) or React Router (web-only)
- Navigation Structure: Stack navigator for hierarchical flows, Tab navigator for primary sections, Drawer for settings/menu
- Route Configuration: Centralized route definitions with lazy loading for code splitting
- Navigation Guards: Authentication middleware to protect private routes
- Deep Linking: Configure URL scheme and universal links for direct screen access

Architecture:
- `/navigation` directory structure:
  - `RootNavigator.tsx` - Main navigation container
  - `AuthNavigator.tsx` - Pre-authentication flows (login, signup)
  - `AppNavigator.tsx` - Post-authentication main app
  - `routes.ts` - Route name constants and type definitions
- Navigation service for imperative navigation outside components
- Type-safe navigation with TypeScript definitions for route params

Features:
- Persistent navigation state (restore on app reload)
- Transition animations matching platform conventions
- Back button handling (hardware/browser)
- Screen tracking analytics integration
- Breadcrumbs for deep navigation hierarchies

State Management:
- Navigation state integrated with app state (Redux/Context)
- Screen-specific data preloading on route change
- History management for back/forward navigation

Accessibility:
- Focus management on screen transitions
- Announce route changes to screen readers
- Keyboard navigation support (tab order, shortcuts)

Performance:
- Screen component code splitting
- Prefetch next likely screens
- Gesture-based navigation with native performance
